yogaClasses.description: Hatha yoga focuses on physical postures, breathing techniques, and meditation. It helps improve flexibility, strength, and overall well-being.
Vinyasa flow yoga is a dynamic style that links movement with breath. It emphasizes continuous flow, strength, and mindfulness.
Ashtanga yoga is a rigorous practice that follows a specific sequence of postures. It builds strength, flexibility, and mental focus.
Kundalini yoga combines dynamic movements, breathing exercises, meditation, and chanting to awaken and harness inner energy.
Bikram yoga, also known as hot yoga, is practiced in a heated room. It involves a series of 26 postures and two breathing exercises.
Yin yoga focuses on passive, long-held poses to target deep connective tissues, promoting relaxation, flexibility, and inner stillness.
Iyengar yoga emphasizes precise alignment and the use of props to support practitioners in achieving optimal posture and balance.
Restorative yoga involves gentle poses held for longer durations, promoting deep relaxation, stress relief, and rejuvenation.
Power yoga is a dynamic and physically challenging style that focuses on building strength, flexibility, and stamina.
Yoga Nidra, also known as yogic sleep, is a deeply relaxing practice that guides you into a state of conscious sleep and deep rest.
